title: [Caffe2] Incorrect capitalization of cmake configuration file
body_html:
The conda package includes a file called Caffe2Config.cmake that is supposed to tell CMake how to use Caffe2. But when I include the command find_package(caffe2) in a CMake script, it gives an error on Linux:

 CMake Warning at CMakeLists.txt:6 (FIND_PACKAGE):
   By not providing "Findcaffe2.cmake" in CMAKE_MODULE_PATH this project has
   asked CMake to find a package configuration file provided by "caffe2", but
   CMake did not find one.

   Could not find a package configuration file provided by "caffe2" with any
   of the following names:

     caffe2Config.cmake
     caffe2-config.cmake

   Add the installation prefix of "caffe2" to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH or set
   "caffe2_DIR" to a directory containing one of the above files.  If "caffe2"
   provides a separate development package or SDK, be sure it has been
   installed.

The problem is that the file is capitalized incorrectly: Caffe2Config.cmake, but it's looking for caffe2Config.cmake. This does work on operating systems that use a case-insensitive file system (macOS, presumably Windows though I haven't tested), but it fails on Linux since it uses a case-sensitive file system.

body:
The conda package includes a file called Caffe2Config.cmake that is supposed to tell CMake how to use Caffe2.  But when I include the command `find_package(caffe2)` in a CMake script, it gives an error on Linux:

```
 CMake Warning at CMakeLists.txt:6 (FIND_PACKAGE):
   By not providing "Findcaffe2.cmake" in CMAKE_MODULE_PATH this project has
   asked CMake to find a package configuration file provided by "caffe2", but
   CMake did not find one.

   Could not find a package configuration file provided by "caffe2" with any
   of the following names:

     caffe2Config.cmake
     caffe2-config.cmake

   Add the installation prefix of "caffe2" to CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH or set
   "caffe2_DIR" to a directory containing one of the above files.  If "caffe2"
   provides a separate development package or SDK, be sure it has been
   installed.
```

The problem is that the file is capitalized incorrectly: Caffe2Config.cmake, but it's looking for caffe2Config.cmake.  This does work on operating systems that use a case-insensitive file system (macOS, presumably Windows though I haven't tested), but it fails on Linux since it uses a case-sensitive file system.
